page.title: 14SUPPLYING LOCAL NEEDS
page.content: Hamsterley attracts thousands of visitors to 3 caravan sites,bed and breakfast accomodation and,of course, the forest.To cater for this influx, particularly during the summer,is a pub with a restaurant,which also serves bar meals,a Working Men's Club, Village Stores for groceries and a Post Office which sells groceries as well as items of hardware.The Butcher Shop is a recent innovation open four days a week and replacing the travelling van.As the village has no natural gas supply the milkman is able to provide calor gas bottles,also available to caravanners,and paraffin for supplementary heating.Coal,coke and oil are brought in by outside contractors.Other services provided through travelling vans are fresh fish a baker,library and fruit and vegetables.Newspapers are delivered.
